Pre-Game Insights: Wales have much to take belief from. Their home record, reading two defeats in 23 (though Poland were one of the two.) The colossal power of the national anthem in the latter stages of their 4-1 victory over Finland on Thursday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Robert Lewandowski has scored 82 goals for Poland – a record surpassed only by Romelu Lukaku, Ferenc Puskas and Cristiano Ronaldo - and is eyeing a last tournament.
Others: It will be a question of collective defending to deter Lewandowski, forward Harry Wilson observed. 'He might not be getting younger, but if we give him half a sniff at goal, he’s going to take it,' the Fulham striker said.
